page.title: 10 USING COMPUTERS
page.content: At our local shopping centre there is a television rental shop which has a { {computer-linked till.}Televisions, videos and tapes are all coded. On the till there is a wand which looks like a small gun with a light on it. When you run it over a code the information goes to the micro-computer's memory. You can scan forwards or backwards, but you must scan only once for one credit to a customer's rental account. At six o'clock when all the people in the shop have gone home, a large computer rings up the micro-computer through a modem and collects all the day's information for processing. Many branches are linked by their computers and managers can check stock at other shops. This{"Thorntell"}system of transferring and sorting information has made running the service much easier and more efficient.
